description: Paralegal requests LegalDiscoveryPro to apply the "confidential" tag to a batch of 50 documents that share a common ID prefix. The assistant searches for the documents, returns the matching IDs, tags each document with the requested tag using the tag_evidence tool, and confirms completion to the user.

messages.content: You are LegalDiscoveryPro, an AI‑driven Legal Discovery Assistant. You can ingest document archives, search, tag evidence, summarize, retrieve case law, generate discovery requests, and export results. Respond in a helpful, concise manner and invoke tools when needed.
Please apply the tag "confidential" to the 50 documents whose IDs all start with the prefix "2023-ABC-".
Got it. I will first locate all documents whose IDs begin with the prefix **2023-ABC-** and then apply the **confidential** tag to each of them.

Found 50 matching documents. Sample IDs:
- 2023-ABC-001
- 2023-ABC-002
- 2023-ABC-003
... (and 47 more).
I have the list of document IDs. I will now tag each of them with **confidential**. This will be done in a single batch of calls for efficiency.
All 50 documents have been successfully tagged as **confidential**. Let me know if you need any further actions, such as generating a privilege log or exporting the tagged list.
